column4: i'm having a problem with my video, i recently installed ubuntu from the cd i just downloaded, then it told me to update, now when i reinstalled all the text is messed up and barely readable
what video card you using?
are you using breezy or dapper?
all the lines and text are broken up and pixelated
is there anything i can update, it was working fine before i restarted after the update
you'll need to know what type of card it is
what brand is it?
can i check it inside linux? because i can't find it on the case
what brand is it? gateway, dell, ibm, lenovo, hp?
toshiba satellite M35
probably intel graphics then
what do you suggest?
did you o a dist-upgrade as well?
have you tried changing your resolution?
system->preferences->screen resolution?
yes
and what all do you have for choices there?
it fixes the problem if it gets smaller like 600x800
as in you set the resolution higher?
LCD screens have what's called "Native Resolutions", a setting at which any below you go, the quality gets worse
when it's 1280x800 it's messed up, if i drop to 600x800 it looks smooth
k.  when you have it at the 1280x800 what is the frequency?
i can't find anything, and it's been a LONG time since i've done anything w/ intel drivers
